topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body:
Does anyone know what the type of games are called where the objective is to take over the map via cutting across it and trapping enemies on the smaller side?

The ones i have played are top down 2d games where there will be a square that is the map, and enemies that move differently around that map. You travel around the edge of the square, and whilst doing so cannot be hit by enemies. Once you go into the square, you will leave a line behind you and once you hit another wall, the side of your line that is smaller gets filled in and all enemies inside of it are destroyed. You win the game by either killing all or enemies or filling in a certain percentage of the map.

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557217886368720dc4721500#post_557217886368720dc4721500
I think I see what the problem with you is. You think everyone is exactly like you. But that's not the case at all.

Me, I had nobody and nothing tell me that people who aren't white aren't lesser than white people. And yet, I never became a racist. In fact, the thought that people with dark skin would be notably different from people white light skin, possibly even inferior, was so alien, I could literally not believe that it's an actual thing. That there are actually people who are so crazy to believe such nonsense.

Just because you, and apparently your entire family, finds it somehow impossible not to be racist without cartoons telling you so, doesn't mean that goes for everyone.
